abstracts.cdata!:
The Industrial Sector Adjustment Credit
            project for Ghana was largely successful. The project got
            off to a good start, and project performance continued
            overall to be quite satisfactory throughout the
            implementation period. Incentive policy reforms (exchange
            rate, price liberalization, import liberalization and export
            promotion measures) were fully implemented and the
            Government continues to maintain these incentive reforms.
            The industrial sector as a whole has also become more
            efficient as a result of policy reforms associated with the
            project. Most aspects of the institution building component
            of the operation were greeted with enthusiasm by the
            beneficiaries in the government agencies concerned. Some of
            the lessons are as follows: The first is that good economic
            and sector work leads to a good project   Second, is the
            importance of having a project reinforce and supplement
            ongoing reforms. Third, it is important for both the
            borrower and IDA to be flexible and adapt to changes in the
            policy environment.  Fourth, intensive supervision, which
            was carried out in this case, greatly enhances project effectiveness.
